Presented by VideoLAN President Jean-Baptiste Kempf, the demo highlighted the use of open-source AI models to generate and translate subtitles into over 100 languages completely offline, ensuring privacy and eliminating the need for cloud services. This feature is built directly into the VLC app, distinguishing it from earlier plug-ins that relied on platforms like OpenAI's Whisper. While the full rollout date hasn't been disclosed, the advancement demonstrates a significant leap in local AI integration for media playback. Additionally, VideoLAN announced that VLC has surpassed 6 billion downloads and continues to grow in active users despite the rise of streaming services.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":38},"pub_date":1736431670,"attribution":"www.theverge.com"},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"www.axios.com","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.axios.com/2023/10/10/ai-videos-transation-languages-lipdub","title":"Startup's AI app dubs videos in different languages","snippet":"A new AI-powered app called Lipdub, developed by New York-based startup Captions, enables users to dub their videos into any of 28 languages—maintaining their own voice and syncing lip movements to the new audio. Available for free on iOS, the app uses generative AI and zero-shot models, which don’t require training on individual speakers, to achieve natural-looking results. Users simply record a video with their face visible, and within minutes receive a dubbed version in the selected language.\n\nCaptions CEO Gaurav Misra highlights the app’s goal of breaking language barriers and giving broader access to storytelling. Despite its impressive capabilities, the technology also raises concerns about the potential for realistic video manipulation. Looking ahead, Misra envisions that generative AI will support real-time language translations in video conferencing and live broadcasts, potentially revolutionizing communication across languages.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":41},"pub_date":1696932000,"attribution":"www.axios.com"}]},{"type":"search_result","url":"https://arxiv.org/abs/2003.00418","title":"Towards Automatic Face-to-Face Translation","snippet":"","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"academia","ref_index":50},"pub_date":null,"attribution":"arxiv.org"},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"synthesia.io","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.synthesia.io/post/best-video-translator-apps?utm_source=chatgpt.com","title":"The 6 Best AI Video Translator Apps of 2025 (Compared) - Synthesia","snippet":"The Best AI Video Translation Apps: Synthesia; Maestra; Elevenlabs; Kapwing; Veed; Rask AI. After two years of testing, the feature is now broadly available and uses Google’s Gemini AI to create translations that mimic the creator’s voice and emotional tone, helping make the dubs sound natural.

Creators can choose between manual dubbing — using their own or professional voiceovers — or automatic dubbing, which uses machine translation and synthetic voices. Automatic dubbing is enabled by default for eligible channels, with an option to review and approve dubs before publishing. Currently, English videos can be auto-translated into Japanese, Hindi, Spanish, and Korean, with more languages coming soon.

Management of audio tracks is handled via YouTube Studio, giving creators control over which dubs to publish or delete. The feature was initially tested with select creators like MrBeast and Jamie Oliver, and the results showed major success — Jamie Oliver’s viewership tripled after implementing dubbed audio. For viewers, the update means easier, more immersive access to international content without relying on subtitles.","attribution_segments":null,"supporting_websites":[],"refs":[{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":46}],"hue":null,"attributions":null,"attribution":"androidcentral.com"}]},{"matched_text":" ","start_idx":1255,"end_idx":1255,"safe_urls":[],"refs":[],"alt":"","prompt_text":null,"type":"sources_footnote","sources":[{"title":"AI Video Translator – Translate Videos into 175+ Languages - HeyGen","url":"https://www.heygen.com/translate?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"HeyGen"},{"title":"Dubly.AI – Translate Videos with AI & Lip Sync | Fast, Natural ...","url":"https://dubly.ai/?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Dubly.AI"},{"title":"Leading AI video localization & dubbing tool","url":"https://www.rask.ai/?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Rask"},{"title":"Perso AI: AI Video Translator & Dubbing with Realistic Lip Sync","url":"https://perso.ai/?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Perso"},{"title":"AI Dubbing Online For Video Localization: Try For Free! | Speechify","url":"https://speechify.com/dubbing/?srsltid=AfmBOop2GNQlI563gz-ICOtfY16FUkz36WYtsJcrBlKFpfiZxb1JWL58&utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Speechify"},{"title":"AI Video Translator: Translate Videos to 110+ Languages","url":"https://www.vozo.ai/video-translate?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Vozo"},{"title":"Free AI Video Translator: Translate Videos to 140+ Languages","url":"https://videotranslator.blipcut.com/?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Video Translator"},{"title":"AI Dubbing & Video Translator - Apps on Google Play","url":"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?hl=en&id=ai.voiser.aidubbing&utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Google Play"},{"title":"AI Video Translator: Translate a video with AI","url":"https://www.canva.com/features/ai-video-translator/?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"Canva"},{"title":"YouTube's new trick automatically re-dubs any video into your native tongue","url":"https://www.androidcentral.com/apps-software/youtube/youtubes-new-trick-automatically-re-dubs-any-video-into-your-native-tongue?utm_source=chatgpt.com","attribution":"androidcentral.com"}],"has_images":false}]
response_text: Here are some AI tools/apps that change a video’s language (translate + dub):  Popular AI video language-changer apps/tools  HeyGen – AI video translator with automatic dubbing & subtitles for 175+ languages. HeyGen [https://www.heygen.com/translate]  Dubly.AI – Translates and lip-syncs videos into many languages with voice cloning. Dubly.AI [https://dubly.ai/]  Rask.ai – AI video localization & dubbing (130+ languages). Rask [https://www.rask.ai/]  Perso AI – AI video translator + voice cloning + precise lip sync. Perso [https://perso.ai/]  Speechify AI Dubbing – Browser-based AI dubbing for videos. Speechify [https://speechify.com/dubbing/?srsltid=AfmBOop2GNQlI563gz-ICOtfY16FUkz36WYtsJcrBlKFpfiZxb1JWL58]  Vozo.ai – Online video translator with AI dubbed audio and lip sync. Vozo [https://www.vozo.ai/video-translate]  BlipCut Video Translator – Free online translator with clipping, dubbing, auto-subs. Video Translator [https://videotranslator.blipcut.com/]  AI Video Translator (mobile app) – Smartphone app that translates/dubs videos into many languages. Google Play+1 [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?hl=en&id=ai.voiser.aidubbing]  Canva also has an AI video translator feature inside its editor. Canva [https://www.canva.com/features/ai-video-translator/]  Bonus: YouTube now offers automatic AI dubbing for videos in multiple languages via its platform for creators. androidcentral.com [https://www.androidcentral.com/apps-software/youtube/youtubes-new-trick-automatically-re-dubs-any-video-into-your-native-tongue]  Want a recommendation for mobile vs. browser options?

Import videos or audios (MP4, MP3, WAV) from your phone—or share directly from ...Read more","domain":"Google Play"},{"url":"https://www.canva.com/features/ai-video-translator/","title":"AI Video Translator: Translate a video with AI","description":"With the free video translator on Canva, you can easily dub videos into multiple languages using advanced AI. Simply select a video from your design, then ...Read more","domain":"Canva"},{"url":"https://www.androidcentral.com/apps-software/youtube/youtubes-new-trick-automatically-re-dubs-any-video-into-your-native-tongue","title":"YouTube's new trick automatically re-dubs any video into your native tongue","description":"September 16, 2025 — YouTube has launched a new multi-language audio feature that allows millions of creators to add dubbed audio tracks to their videos, significantly breaking down language barriers and expanding global reach. After two years of testing, the feature is now broadly available and uses Google’s Gemini AI to create translations that mimic the creator’s voice and emotional tone, helping make the dubs sound natural.

Creators can choose between manual dubbing — using their own or professional voiceovers — or automatic dubbing, which uses machine translation and synthetic voices. Automatic dubbing is enabled by default for eligible channels, with an option to review and approve dubs before publishing. Currently, English videos can be auto-translated into Japanese, Hindi, Spanish, and Korean, with more languages coming soon.

Management of audio tracks is handled via YouTube Studio, giving creators control over which dubs to publish or delete. The feature was initially tested with select creators like MrBeast and Jamie Oliver, and the results showed major success — Jamie Oliver’s viewership tripled after implementing dubbed audio. For viewers, the update means easier, more immersive access to international content without relying on subtitles.","domain":"androidcentral.com"}]
